data.text:
NEW YORK - Albany County to Putnam County

Additional Information can be Found At:

Congressional Medal of Honor - http://www.cmohs.org/

Faces of Valor, Honor the Fallen - http://projects.militarytimes.com/valor/

Historical Marker Database - http://www.hmdb.org//

Iraqi Casualties - http://icasualties.org/OEF/USCasualtiesByState.aspx

Memorial Day Foundation - http://www.memorialdayfoundation.org/

New York Architecture - http://www.nyc-architecture.com/TEN/TEN-Monuments.htm

New York City Parks (Used with Permission - Permission does not constitute endorsement of this site.) http://www.nycgovparks.org/art-and-antiquities/permanent-art-and-monuments/results?search_text=War+Memorial&borough=&googleClientId=689238403.1452028265 Note: Strong encouragement is given to explore the New York City Parks website. So many more Memorials and Monuments to other heroes who were not involved in wartime efforts like firemen, policemen, priests, ordinary citizens, etc., are described and documented in detail.

New York Division of Veterans' Affairs - http://www.veterans.ny.gov/

New York Korean War Casualties - http://www.vetfriends.com/memorial/mem_alphab.cfm?war_id=3&page_id=1&states_id=34

New York Vietnam War Casualties - http://www.vetfriends.com/memorial/mem_alphab.cfm?war_id=4&page_id=1&states_id=34

Old Fort Niagara - http://www.oldfortniagara.org/history

US World War I Casualty Records - https://familysearch.org/learn/wiki/en/United_States_World_War_I_Casualty_Records

New York City - Understanding locations in New York City can be challenging. The city is divided into five boroughs. Those five boroughs are further divided into neighborhoods. It is the goal of this site to provide as accurate as possible, the locations of the Memorials, Monuments, and Makers. The boroughs will be listed with the associated county and, if needed, subdivided by neighborhoods. NOTE: Although as many neighborhoods as possible are listed for the boroughs, not all neighborhoods have listings for Memorials, Monuments, or Markers. The first three borough are listed here:

Boroughs

The Bronx - Bronx County - Northwest Bronx (Bedford Park, Belmont, Fordham, Kingsbridge, Marble Hill, Norwood, Riverdale, University Heights, Woodlawn); Southwest Bronx (Concourse, Downtown Bronx, East Tremont, Highbridge, Hunts Point, Longwood, Melrose, Morris Heights, Morrisania, Mott Haven, The Hub, Tremont, West Farms); Northeast Bronx (Allerton, Baychester, Bronxdale, City Island, Co-op City, Eastchester, Edenwald, Indian Village, Laconia, Olinville, Morris Park, Pelham Gardens, Pelham Parkway, Van Nest, Wakefield, Williamsbridge); Southeast Bronx (Bronx River, Bruckner, Castle Hill, Clason Point, Country Club, Edgewater park, Harding Park , Parkchester, Park Versailles, Westchester Heights, Pelham Bay, Soundview, Schuylerville, Throggs Neck, Unionport, Westchester Square); Islands (The Pelham Islands, North Brother Island, South Brother Island, Rikers Island)

Brooklyn (Located entirely on Long Island) - Kings County - Northwestern Brooklyn (Brooklyn Heights, Brooklyn Navy Yard, Cadan Plaza, Clinton Hill, Downtown Brooklyn, DUMBO, Fort Greene, Fulton Ferry, Pacific Park, Prospect Heights, Vinegar Hill); **South Brooklyn -takes its name from the geographical position of the original town of Brooklyn, which today includes the neighborhoods listed above under the heading "Northwestern Brooklyn." It is not located in the southern part of the modern borough. (Boerum Hill, Carroll Gardens, Columbia Street Waterfront District, Cobble Hill, Gowanus, Park Slope, South Park Slope, Greenwood Heights, Red Hook) Northeastern Brooklyn (Bedford-Stuyvesant); Central Brooklyn (Crown Heights, Ditmas Park, Flatbush, Prospect Park); Western Brooklyn (Bath Beach, Bay Ridge, Bensonhurst, Borough Park, Dyker Heights, Mapleton, New Ultrecht, Sunset Park); Southern Brooklyn (Barren Island, Bergen Beach, Coney Island, Flatlands, Gerritsen Beach, Gravesend, Homecrest, Marine Park, Mill Basin, Plumb Beach, Sheepshead Bay); Eastern Brooklyn (Brownsville, Canarsie, East New York, Highland Park); Northern Brooklyn (Bushwick, East Williamsburg, Greenpoint, Williamsburg)

Manhattan - New York County - Uptown Neighborhoods (Upper Manhattan, Marble Hill, Inwood, Fort George, Washington Heights, Hudson Heights, West Harlem, Hamilton Heights, Manhattanville, Morningside Heights, Central Harlem, Harlem, Strivers Row, Astor Row, Sugar Hill, Marcus Garvey Park, Le Petit Senegal, East Harlem, Upper East Side, Lenox Hill, Carnegie Hill, Yorkville, Upper West Side, Manhattan Valley, Lincoln Square); Midtown Neighborhoods (Midtown, Columbus Circle, Sutton Place, Rockefeller Center, Diamond District, Theater District, Turtle Bay, Midtown East, Midtown, Tudor City, Little Brazil, Times Square; Hudson Yards, Midtown West, Hell's Kitchen, Garment District, Herald Square, Koreatown, Murray Hill, Tenderloin, Madison Square) Midtown and Downtown (Flower District, Brookdale, Hudson Yards, Kips Bay, Rose Hill, NoMad, Peter Cooper Village, Chelsea, Flatiron District, Gramercy Park, Stuyvesant Square, Union Square, Stuyvesant Town, Meatpacking District, Waterside Plaza); Downtown Neighborhoods (Also Known as Lower Manhattan) - Downtown Manhattan, Little German, Alphabet City and Loisaida, East Village, Greenwich Village, NoHo; Bowery, West Village, Lower East Side, SoHo, Nolita, Little Italy, Chinatown, Financial District, Five Points, Cooperative Village, Two Bridges, Tribeca, Civic Center, Radio Row, South Street Seaport, Battery Park City); Islands (Ellis, Governors, Liberty, Randalls, Wards, Roosevelt)​

​Please click on the county listed below to be directed to that county. CMHR stands for Congressional Medal of Honor Recipients and redirects to the list of recipients for New York State.
